Analytics Engineer (Remote within Canada)*About Rewind: *Rewind is a service that protects the data that is driving your business, from a simple side hustle to a successful venture. Our focus is on backing up data that lives in the cloud – in apps like Shopify, BigCommerce, and QuickBooks Online. We invite you to read our startup story to learn where we came from and where we’re going. For a more technical view, check out our Behind the App feature on the BigCommerce Developers Blog.We care about honesty, we believe in learning from our mistakes, and we support each other as we grow.*About the Role: *You will be a part of a small, but growing data team which is responsible for making data accessible to everyone at Rewind.We are looking for an Analytics Engineer who will help deliver well-defined, tested, and code-reviewed data models to our business users and downstream systems. This will help the company strategically use our data to operate and grow the business.Responsibilities include: Build & maintain high quality datasets and provide reliable access to the rest of the business.You'll be the go-to analytics specialist, helping to bridge the gap between business needs and the data models needed to support them.Help define our overall data strategy, from raw data to finished reports and the data made available to our internal tools.About You: We're looking for someone who: Has 3+ years experience as an analytics engineer, data analysts, or similar roleIs familiar with or excited by modern data tools. Our data stack includes Airbyte, dbt, and BigQuery.Has expert knowledge in SQL for data transformation and analysis.Has a strong understanding of data quality testing.Has excellent time management, prioritization, and accountability over their work.Knows how to work in data warehouses (BigQuery, Snowflake, or similar).It would be great, but not essential, if you have: Experience transforming data using dbt.A background in SaaS and an understanding of typical SaaS business metrics.Experience working with BigQuery, Airbyte, Fivetran, Metabase or similar tools.Above all, you should be excited to join a fast moving company. This means being comfortable with ambiguity and taking full ownership over your work.*About our Hiring Process: *You can expect us to be curious about who you are, what experiences you have gained to date and what you are looking for in your next opportunity. We know that you are selecting us as an employer just as much as we are inviting you to join our team. We will provide a series of opportunities for us to connect and for you to meet various members of our team. Please ask us questions and let us know how we can support you throughout our hiring process.Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your background is close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying, even if you aren’t able to check every box above. We don’t hire people to fill boxes - each new hire is an opportunity for us to augment our collective perspective and to make us a stronger team… and that is where you come in!We are dedicated to providing an inclusive and supportive workplace where all of our teammates can bring their full and authentic selves to work... everyday. As a proud equal opportunity employer, we consider all applicants for employment and certainly invite those who identify as members of underrepresented communities to apply and join our team! And hey - we may not have a role available today that would be exciting to you, but we are growing fast and would love to have you join our talent community.You will be a part of a small, but growing data team which is responsible for making data accessible to everyone at RewindJob Type: Full-time

field.You are able to balance multiple projects and deliver quality results on timeYou have excellent analytical, organizational and problem solving skills, as well as a strong attention to detail.You knowledge of process mapping and predetermined time study methodologies such as MOST or MODAPTSStrong competency with database, spreadsheet, Autocad, and presentation software.Who you are: You are Job Title: Operations Analyst – Graduate Engineer in Training (EIT)
Job Description: Overview / Responsibilities:Wood’s Operations Analysis Group specialises in providing simulation modelling services to international mining, manufacturing, processing and infrastructure clients. We are dedicated to adding value to our client's operations by using the latest discrete-event simulation, operations research, modelling and data analytics techniques.The Opportunity:Work in a Vancouver-based team of solution-focussed individuals on various consulting projects.Gain exposure to all aspects of the consulting process from problem definition, data gathering and analysis to model development, scenario evaluation and client presentations.Grow within the role with development of both technical / analytical expertise and consulting / project management skills.A truly unique opportunity with a unique group, your opportunity will be limited only by your ability to provide value to our clients and to contribute to the growth of the company. Keep your eye on the prize and reach for the brass ring...you'll be amazed at what comes of it!The Role:Wood’s employees follow the core principles of providing high-calibre professional services in a fully integrated manner across our operating business units and divisions. The following outline represents an overview of the role:Developing and implementing appropriate statistical applications and decision support tools for diverse projects in a variety of industries.Managing, compiling and statistically analyzing operations data including data mining, simulation, computer modeling, linear programming, and other mathematical techniques.Utilizing superior mathematical and computer skills for modeling and balancing multiple projects and competing deadlines.Interacting with clients to understand and analyze operations processes and modeling requirements.Preparing reports for external clients and of briefing documents for internal review.Assisting in developing tools and techniques to improve approaches.Assisting in Business Development activities, including seeking business opportunities and preparing proposal documents.Skills / Qualifications:The Successful Candidate will score highly against the following criteria:Recently completed a degree in Engineering (Mechanical or Engineering Physics preferred)A logical and rational approach to problem solving.Excellent conceptual skills and an aptitude for developing models to simulate real world systems.Competent programming skills in a high-level language.A high degree of professional integrity and confident presentation skills.General knowledge of and/or exposure to the mining and mineral processing, oil and gas, and transportation and supply chain industries.Experience and proficiency in VBA, discrete-event simulation software (e.g., AnyLogic, Arena, Simio).Experience and proficiency in Python, R, Tableau and other data analysis software.Machine Learning and Reinforcement Learning applied to discrete-event simulation modelling.Company Overview:Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.comDiversity Statement (EEO):We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. Job Title: Quantitative Engineer - Global Markets - FAST X-Asset Strats
Job Description: MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:We are seeking a talented individual to join Goldman Sachs fulltime in the Global Markets division as a Quantitative Engineer ("Applied AI Strat") at the Associate level on the FAST X-Asset Strats team in Toronto.Global MarketsIn the Global Markets Division our core value is building strong relationships with our institutional clients, which include corporations, financial service providers, and fund managers. We help them buy and sell financial products on exchanges around the world, raise funding, and manage risk. This is a dynamic, entrepreneurial team with a passion for the markets, with individuals who thrive in fast-paced, changing environments and are energized by a bustling trading floor.Quantitative EngineerAt Goldman Sachs, our engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Our Quantitative Engineers ("strats") are at the cutting edge of our Global Markets businesses, solving real-world problems through a variety of analytical methods.As an Applied AI Strat, you will use your advanced training in mathematics, programming and logical thinking to construct AI-based quantitative models that drive our success in global financial markets. Your talents for research, analysis and aptitude for innovation will define your contributions and enable you to find solutions to a broad range of problems, in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.Whatever your background, you will bring a fresh perspective and unique skillset to our business. In return, you will be trained by our experts across the firm to navigate the complexities of the financial markets and state-of-the-art methods in quantitative finance.FAST X-Asset StratsAs a Franchise Analytics, Strategy & Technology (FAST) X-Asset Strat, you will be working closely with the business to design, build and productionise end-to-end AI solutions and products that drive real time decision making.RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:ResponsibilitiesDesign and build scalable AI models to drive commercial outcomesConduct experimentation to improve model performanceCommunicate verbally and in writing to both strats and non-stratsImprove existing and create new predictive machine learning models to drive real time trading and client service decisionsUnderstand and analyze products and clients quantitatively, engineer features, and incorporate into modelsIdentify, curate, and integrate new structured and unstructured datasets into modelsBuild end to end solutions from data collection to automated actionsBasic QualificationsBachelors degree or above in a STEM areaProgramming experience in C++, Java, or Python and strong knowledge of data structures and algorithms2 years experience as data scientist or academic work related to Machine Learning / Deep Learning / NLPExcellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and experience with common data science toolkitsPrevious experience with A/B testing, hypothesis testing and experimental designPreferred QualificationsExperience in quantitative researchKnowledge of financial markets and experience with financial data setsABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHSAt Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Tucows (NASDAQ:TCX, TSX:TC) is possibly the biggest Internet company you've never heard of. We started as a simple shareware site in 1993 and have grown into a stable of businesses; mobile, internet and domains.We embrace a people-first philosophy that is rooted in respect, trust, and flexibility. We believe that whatever works for our employees is what works best for us. It's also why the majority of our roles are remote-first, meaning you can work from anywhere you can connect to the internet!Today, close to a thousand people work in over 16 countries to help us make the Internet better. If this sounds exciting to you, join the herd!This is a completely remote opportunity within Canada and USA.Tucows is looking to add an Analytics Engineer to our Analytics, Insights and Reporting team, reporting to the Head of Analytics & Insights. Together, we're responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, and related business intelligence operations within our quickly growing company. We've got a lot of data, and we're looking for someone to help us get the most out of it.You and the data analysts will work with business, product, and engineering stakeholders to understand their needs and priorities, as well as to collaborate and ensure that their reporting requirements are captured in the development process. You'll then work with data engineers to build data pipelines, acquiring data from source systems and moving it through our data hierarchy, from messy and raw to clean, aggregated and documented. You'll train analysts and business stakeholders on how to use the data sets you create.Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Use DBT to deliver and maintain clean, transformed data models ready for analyticsUnderstand business needs and technical requirements to meet those needsTroubleshoot variances in reports, and strive to eliminate them at the sourceDocument your data models and provide training as neededIncorporate engineering best practices on version control, testing, CI/CDKey Skills and Experience:Experience with DBTTop-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skillsExcellent problem solving skills3+ years experience handling, manipulating, and documenting dataStrong expertise with an SQL language, database structures and data lake architecturesNice to Have:Experience with AirflowExperience with LookerEducation:Post-secondary education in a technical field, or B.S./M.S.Want to know more about what we stand for? At Tucows we care about protecting the open Internet, narrowing the digital divide, and supporting fairness and equality.We also know that diversity drives innovation. We are committed to inclusion across race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We celebrate multiple approaches and diverse points of view.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.Learn more about Tucows, our culture and employee benefits on our site here.

ACV’s mission is to build and enable the most trusted and efficient digital marketplaces for buying and selling used vehicles with transparency and comprehensive data that was previously unimaginable. Company DescriptionMicrochip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.Job DescriptionThis role reports to the VP of Data Center Solutions (DCS) within Microchip and has responsibility for all functions related to marketing and applications engineering for DCS.Microchip’s Data Center Solutions (DCS) group is a fast-growing business, in excess of $500M annual review, with a vision to connect, manage and secure the world’s information by being the preferred partner for storage, memory and compute connectively as well as end-point solutions for the world’s data centers. DCS provides a broad portfolio of innovative silicon, board and software solutions. DCS product lines include Smart Storage Solutions comprised of RAID and I/O Controllers with SAS/SATA/NVMe interfaces, Flashtec NVMe SSD controllers, Switchtec PCIe Switches and Smart Memory Controllers with CXL interfaces. DCS products provide an anchor for Total System Solutions for the Data Center market based on the broad Microchip product portfolio.This position leads a world-wide organization of ~100 employees to set strategic direction, define products, win new customer designs, establish business agreements with customers and ecosystem partners, execute go-to-market plans, deliver technical training and customer support and manage customer and industry relationships. The organization includes Strategic Account Management, Product Line Management, Channel Marketing, Strategic Ecosystem Management and Applications Engineering. This leadership role works closely with Engineering R&D leaders, Business Operations, Sales, Finance and HR partners to achieve the business goals.Job RequirementsThe successful candidate will have a technical background in silicon-based solutions with extensive business and marketing experience. A track record of growing businesses and successfully managing the complexities of bringing multiple product lines to market across multiple market segments within the Data Center market. The successful candidate should have experience managing large originations across multiple sites. Depending on the level of experience of the candidate this position may be established as Senior Director or Associate Vice President of the Business Unit.#LI-ST1#ZR

Job Title: Analyst - Financial Engineering and Modeling- AML
Job Description: Job Type: PermanentPrimary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; Burlington; Kitchener; London; Ottawa; Vaughan; WindsorOur PurposeAt Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coachingBe encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.Have many careers in one Firm.Would you like to further develop your career with our exponentially expanding Financial Advisory Service, Modelling and Value Advisory group? Are you up for the challenge to help the most sophisticated Canadian and International clients to solve their quantitative and modelling issues?What will your typical day look like?In this role you will help financial services industry (FSI) clients face quantitative issues with informed confidence. Using your deep technical skills and leveraging our global network of experts, you’ll provide professional advice to our FSI clients in a wide range of situations. The result? Our clients will be better placed to take control and receive the best solutions to their complex challenges.Develop/validate/review AML/ATF models (e.g. Transaction Monitoring, Client Risk Rating, and Sanction Screening models) based on regulatory guidelines and industry best practices.You will also be able to learn and work in other quantitative and analytical areas including customer behavior modeling, scenario modelling, capital optimization problems, and new innovations such as cloud computing, machine learning and artificial intelligence.About the teamDeloitte’s Financial Advisory practice delivers highly specialized advisory solutions for companies facing critical business events where significant value is at stake, in every phase of the economic cycle.Our work is often high profile, high impact, and highly rewarding. If you’re looking for a challenge and an opportunity to grow your career alongside the best and brightest in the industry, you’ll find it in Financial Advisory at Deloitte. Broaden your skills. Broaden your reach. Broaden your career. It’s all possible at Deloitte.Enough about us, let’s talk about youIdeally, you are someone with:Minimum 1/2 years of relevant experience spent within a model development or model validation team at a major financial institution; AML/ATF model related development and validation experience are a plusSolid academic background with a master’s degree in Statistics, Financial Engineering, Quantitative/Mathematical Finance, Financial Economics, Financial Risk Management, or other relevant post graduate degreeSolid knowledge and hands-on experience in classification model development/validation using both traditional techniques as well as AI/machine learning techniquesSolid knowledge and hands-on experience in developing/validating predictive models, risk rating methodology; Knowledge in developing/validating text parsing and matching algorithms is a plusStrong programming skills in Python, R, SQL, SAS, VBA, etc. with hands-on experience working with large and complex data are critical to success; Automation experience with any of these programming languages is a plusSelf-starter, fast-learner, and highly motivated individual who can excel under fast-paced environment and meet stringent deadlines; Strong communication skills are criticalKnowledge/experience of supervisory/regulatory requirements and guidelines including OSFI E-23, FINTRAC guidelines on AML/ATF, and PCMLTFA. Knowledge of industry best practices for AML/ATF such as Wolfsberg Principles is a plusCanadian travel required and occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignmentsOur shared valuesWhile our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.The next step is yoursSound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now!At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

100% REMOTE Senior Analytics EngineerIf you are a 100% REMOTE Senior Analytics Engineer with Looker experience, please read on!We are an award-winning start-up that has successfully unified the enterprise brand experience by disrupting the customer support space. Our SaaS platform has replaced convoluted systems such as Lines and Contact Numbers for standard customer support, through fingerprint, verification, real-time sharing, and effortless in-app texting. The work we have done has appeared in Forbes, Bloomberg, CX Today + more! At SCI our people make us even better, which is why we want you to be a part of our fast growing organization. SCI recognizes that having a great team is the key to success, which is why we attract and retain the right people with an employee experience that focuses on building trust, embracing change, and achieving our goals together. Any one of our 3000 industry experts will tell you that we take on some of Canada’s toughest service and logistic challenges in specialized transportation, technical services, and supply chain management. For 30 years, our proficient planning and flexible solutions have brought us top tier clients. With clear focus, operational excellence, and future growth at the core of our operation, we apply out-of-the-box thinking to deliver exceptional experiences that take our clients to the next level. Are you ready for your next challenge?The Solutions Analyst will be a valuable member in contributing to SCI’s future. This individual will be responsible for developing and supporting innovative supply chain solutions and continuous improvement initiatives for SCI’s new or existing clients. The Solutions Analyst will work directly with the Solutions Design, Implementations and Operations teams to support business analysis, detailed process mapping and analysis, transportation analysis and rating as well as other ad hoc tasks such as inventory configuration, rate comparison and analysis and facility design and location mapping. In addition, the Analyst will provide support to the Product Development team to enable SCI to achieve our short and long term business objectives. Lastly, as a member of our core team, the right person for the role will be a leading example of our culture.What success looks like: You provide a strong ability to analyse processes and data, and draw summary conclusions from the gathered dataYou are a trusted partner supporting the Operations and Implementations teams through the execution and build out of the final operational designYou support Solutions continuous improvement achievement through leading the cross-functional initiatives, reviewing and tracking key projects and initiatives across the teamYou support Solutions, Implementations and Product Development with efficient executive reporting related to key projects across the functional teamYou provide meaningful insights to support optimal solution design based on comprehensive data analysisYour business partners are excited to collaborate with you! You support one another as a team and work together, leveraging everyone’s strengths.You are depended on to see your commitments through and with good intentions.Support attainment of SCI annual target new business revenuesDemonstrate a clear understanding of corporate vision, culture and goals and incorporate these into all business solution designs and continuous improvement initiatives.Perform other duties as assigned by direct manager in support of SCI’s continued growth and success.What you bring to the role: Bachelor Degree in Industrial Engineering or related field.You are able to balance multiple projects and deliver quality results on timeYou have excellent analytical, organizational and problem solving skills, as well as a strong attention to detail.You stay current with industry trends and provide recommendations that support company growth.When making decisions, you consider everyone and engage those who can add value to the process.Working knowledge of process mapping and predetermined time study methodologies such as MOST or MODAPTSStrong competency with database, spreadsheet, Autocad, and presentation software.Who you are: You are passionate about data analytics, facility design and optimization.You are driven to achieve and enable others to deliver operational excellence.You are comfortable balancing multiple projects, supporting different managers, ensuring prioritization and alignment with key stakeholdersYou have the courage to think differently about how things get done to continuously improve and deliver even better results every day.The safety, health, and well-being of yourself and other team members is your first priority.You uphold your commitments and make decisions with everyone in mind.You are energized by collaborating in a team environment, and enjoy supporting others to find success.You embrace new things, are open to different perspectives, and adapt quickly to an evolving environment.You establish and reinforce a culture of exceptional customer service.Working at SCI: First and foremost, at SCI, we are committed to creating a safe and healthy work environment, which is why we support our people with programs that serve the health and wellness of everyone. We also recognize that business moves quickly, and we strongly believe that success in our fast-paced environment is defined by the achievements of all our employees. We pride ourselves in the collaborative approach we apply to our work, and with a flat organizational structure, each employee at SCI is empowered to make a difference every day. Our people find success through their desire to discover new strengths, learn new skills, and gain unique experiences. With a balanced compensation portfolio, we encourage our people to lead with agility and strive for excellence.SCI is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the selection process.We thank all candidates for applying, however, only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $28,007.00-$108,135.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:Supply chain or Logistics: 1 year (preferred)

Position Title: Manager Transportation Analytics & ProjeRequisition ID: 26425Career Group (ADSP): Distribution CenterDivision: Logistics and Distribution (80190524)Department: Logistics and DistributionPosition Location: METRO ON - 5559 DUNDAS STREET W (#A-DUND)Position Type: PermanentSummaryThis role will be responsible for overseeing the planning, execution and governance of projects within the transportation department. This includes overseeing projects that will focus on overall network optimization to reduce costs and improve store service levels. The individual will oversee the team that reports daily, weekly and monthly transportation KPI's to stakeholders. The individual will be responsible for developing a continuous improvement culture with high employee engagement throughout the department, as well as leading and mentoring direct reports to promote professional development.Specific ResponsibilitiesFront End Engineering: Lead cross-functional teams to properly define problem statements, identify the scope of projects, and validate the root-cause of issues. Develop solutions to drive the best return on investment and store service levels.Project Management & Execution: Oversee the successful execution of projects by leading cross-functional teams to ensure the project is delivered on time, on scope and on budget. Track progress towards outcomes and identify/escalate issues in a timely fashion.Benefits Realization: Where projects are expected to deliver savings/service improvements, oversee the development of processes, KPI's, and baseline metrics to track, monitor and ensure savings/service improvements to the business are achieved.Reporting: Manage and oversee the development of reporting tools and the tracking of department KPI's. Ensure KPI's are sent out to all stakeholders in a timely manner (daily, weekly, monthly). Present department KPI's and project updates in weekly & monthly meetings with Senior Leadership.Coaching & Mentoring: Facilitate a continuous learning environment through knowledge sharing, building a team- based work environment and contributing to overall professional development of the team.Master Data: Establish master data validation processes for both the Ontario & Quebec transportation departments. Oversee the development of strategies and tools to ensure master data is maintained accurately. Lead the team that will perform Master Data audits.Network Optimization: Manage optimization projects that will focus on reducing overall transportation costs, increasing department efficiencies and improving store service levels. This will include building models and running simulations to determine the effect across the full transportation network.Business Support: Represent the transportation department in cross-functional projects that are being driven by other departments (IT, Supply Chain, Accounting, Store Operations etc.), or with external parties such as outside carriers.Change Management: When going through the development and implementation of projects, identify, analyze and prepare risk mitigation tactics. Identify and manage anticipated resistance, manage stakeholders, educate users and ensure user readiness.Continuous Improvement: Develop a culture that views continuous improvement as a key contributor to drive operation excellence, employee engagement and ownership. Engage department employees to identify areas where quick wins can be achieved.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering or related field requiredMaster's degree in Supply Chain Management or MBA preferredAdvance knowledge of excel, including VBA coding and macros requiredProficient with TMS (JDA), SAP and MS OfficeMinimum 5 to 7 years experience working in a continuous improvement roleMinimum 5 to 7 years experience working in the supply chain/distribution industryLean Six Sigma Green/Black Belt certification preferredCertified Project Management Professional (PMP®) is an assetExperience leading projects on cross-functional teams and supervising direct reportsAbility to travel as requiredRelationshipsStore Operations, Vendors, Central Procurement, Replenishment, Merchandise, Disctribution Centers, and Supply ChainMetro values, respects and leverages the differences and competences of all employees from a variety of different backgrounds. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment.Metro is committed to accommodating applicants and employees with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation or wish to receive this application in an accessible format, please advise.Only applicants that meet the qualifications will be contacted.We respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from agencies.

We are expanding our Software Development team with two more business intelligence engineers to accelerate insights and analytics development here at Altus. As part of the Program Insights team, you’ll be a core contributor to our Analytics product, helping grow and scale our data warehouse and dashboard system designed for our customers in higher education.As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you’ll collaborate with product managers and product designers to come up with ways to visualize business intelligence questions like “Is my student failing?” and “Compare how my course is doing year over year”. You’ll design, architect and roll out Qlik-based solutions, working directly with other developers and customers on engineering impactful data visualizations and discovering meaningful data trends. You’ll leverage your deep knowledge of Qlik and best practices for building performant, scalable apps. You’ll tackle permission issues, establish best practices for variables, formulas, and load, and discover areas where we can improve our processes to make future Qlik development more manageable, better and faster.In addition to Qlik, you’ll work across tools and technologies like Git, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Python, JavaScript, ReactJS and CSS.The work you do will contribute to our greater mission of creating a world filled with more people-centred, empathetic doctors, nurses, teachers and other professionals.This is a full-time position based in Canada and reports to our Development Manager for the Program Insights, Scott Hsieh. We are a remote-first company. To accommodate employees that want or need an office or prefer a hybrid option, we returned to a limited office presence in Toronto in January 2022. We provide co-working space opportunities for employees outside the GTA.Collaborative work typically takes place between 9 am PST - 2 pm PST / 12 pm EST - 5 pm EST, with most team members working either within the PST or EST time zones.In this role, you will:Develop, maintain, enhance and support Qlik Sense applications.Provide expertise in Qlik Sense programming and ensure application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint.Make recommendations on best practices, managing/storing data, setting up roles, section access, site setup and creating dashboards.Conduct in-depth analysis with interpretive thinking to define issues and develop innovative solutions with Qlik Sense and data warehouse.Write complex Qlik Set Analysis formulae within apps and data load-scripts.Gather requirements from stakeholders and end-users to review, analyze and translate into technical specifications.To thrive in the role, you:Have worked with Qlik for 3 years or more, and have some professional experience in a programming or data analytics-focused role.Have expertise in data modelling and optimized data modelling for Qlik visualizations and Qlik set analysis and formulas.Proficiently can work with Qlik permission and section access, extensions.Have professional experience with data cleaning, data analysis and visualization techniques.Are experienced with Qlik mashups and managing Qlik application deployments.Have a “Qlik Sense Data Architect” or “Qlik Sense System Administrator” Certification.Have a knack for spotting mistakes in data and choosing data that best represents larger datasets.Understand UI/UX best practices.Are comfortable utilizing a version control system, such as Git or Bitbucket.To thrive at Altus, you are:Able to live our core values of Caring, Curious, Driven while cultivating a positive and professional attitude.Someone who prefers working in an entrepreneurial environment where you get to be a builder, doer, and optimizer, work autonomously, challenge the status quo and help us focus where it counts.A person with loosely held yet strong opinions. You know why you want what you want and remain humble, accept that you can be wrong, and constantly seek to create better solutions.Highly curious about how our business works and genuinely interested in the Higher Education and Education Technology industry.Driven by our mission to create a world served by exceptional professionals.The interview processWe designed our process to give you a positive experience and follow equitable assessment practices. We've outlined the general steps you can expect to go through below.Intro Conversation. An actual human from our People & Culture team will review your application. If selected, you’ll be able to share your story and experiences and learn more about the role, team, and company in more detail. (Time allocation: 30 - 45 minutes)Meet The Manager. You'll meet your potential future manager via a video call to discuss your background and experiences in more depth. (Time allocation: 30 - 60 minutes)Meet The Team. You'll meet with 2-4 members of our team over a video call. They will assess your technical skills, values alignment, and how you might contribute to our culture. Before this interview, you may complete an assignment that closely mirrors some aspects of the role and present your work to the team. (Time allocation: up to 3 hours)Reference Checks. We'll ask you for 2-3 professional references we can reach out to and chat about your time working together.Wait For a Final Decision. While you wait, the Hiring Manager consolidates and evaluates feedback from each team member who was part of your interview process. We may reach out to you for a quick additional conversation to reach a decision.Receive an Offer. If you are our match and we believe you feel the same way, we'll extend an offer and go over the details with you on a video call. (Time allocation: 20 minutes)We offer youA Competitive Salary. We've designed our total rewards strategy to compensate you above the Canadian-based tech market rate.Flexible, Self-Directed Vacation. Take time off when you need it. We recommend one week per quarter in addition to federal and provincial statutory holidays and company-wide paid time off, but there are no firm rules. We trust you.Company-wide Paid Time Off. We turn off our work on Altus Days (a bonus Friday off every month) and the last two weeks in December (for the Holiday Season).GRSP Matching Program. If you choose to participate in our Group Registered Savings Plan program through Wealthsimple, we match your contribution up to 2% of your salary each pay period, pre-tax income.Stock Option Plan. To benefit from the growth you contribute to and the opportunity for future ownership in the company, we grant you options that start vesting on your first day of employment.Learning & Development Budget. We've allocated an annual budget of $3,000 you can use towards your professional and personal growth.Access to Health Coverage from Day 1. You can enroll in our comprehensive health, dental, vision, and life benefits plan through Equitable Life of Canada on the day you join us.Parental Leave With Top-Up. Growing your family is an exciting time, and we support and encourage you to take time off with your new loved ones. 4 months of your parental leave topped up to 80% of your salary. You can extend your parental leave with top-up payments for four months if you choose.Sick Time, Other Leave. Take paid time off when you're experiencing illness, a medical or family emergency, the loss of a loved one, or need to nurture your wellness.Choose Where You Work. Work from home, our office space in downtown Toronto, in a coworking space, or take your work on the road for a little while. If you live outside of the GTA and want to rent a coworking desk, we've got you covered for up to $150 per month.Home Office Workspace Equipment. You'll receive a Mac laptop or equivalent of your choice, and we'll support you with other workspace accommodations you need for your home office.Transparency. Through our weekly All Hands and monthly financial updates, you'll have visibility into business metrics, progress, performance and overall company health.A little about usAt Altus, we've built a HigherEd Program Intelligence Platform that supports higher education programs and students from application to graduation. Armed with data from admissions, student assessment and program operations, schools can identify and train diverse, exceptional and people-centred professionals.We're a quirky, vibrant, and diverse group of 140+ working together remotely across Canada to tackle challenging problems (like evaluating empathy in someone who wants to train to become a doctor) and some less tough ones (like how to answer that bonus question on Trivia Night).Our core values are Caring, Curious, and Driven, and we embody these in everything we do. We genuinely care about the well-being of others, we possess an innate desire to learn continually, and every day we strive to be better than the person we were the day before.We believe diverse and inclusive teams bring more perspective to the table, build better products, drive greater financial outcomes and create a better workplace. That is why we focus on being an equitable company and emphasize a culture of belonging for everyone, regardless of your race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, and veteran or disability status.Thank you for considering Altus as your next career stop!

IntroductionAt IBM, work is more than a job – it’s a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you’ve never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world’s most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.Your Role and ResponsibilitiesYou have extensive experience in your field and practical experience in consulting services, including in public sector organizations. In your role as Azure Power BI lead, you will assist our client in the selection, implementation and support of the integrated solutions selected for the transformation of its organization. Candidates will use their in-depth consulting, business solutions and integrated solutions expertise to support the client in the redesign of its systems to achieve the expected results. Candidates must have demonstrated strong experience as team leaders and be able to work independently at the client’s site. Experience working with remote development teams is an asset.Good working knowledge of the integration of various reporting tools on PowerBIExperience in conversion and replacement of existing operational data warehouses: analysis of the existing model, determination of the target model, loading and validation of the dataKnowledge of PowerBI tools and Microsoft Azure environmentsKnowledge of Azure based environments, SQL DB is an assetKnowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake and Azure databricksKnowledge/experience in preparing data for advanced processing (data mining) on a Azure platform is an assetExperience in managing the development of complex reports in an energy sector organization is an assetAbility to work with data and have good data analysis & engineering skillsPreferred Technical and Professional ExpertiseSame as above.Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.Key Job DetailsCountry/Region:CAState:ALBERTACity:CalgaryCategory:ArchitectRequired Education:Bachelor's DegreePosition Type:ProfessionalEmployment Type:Full-TimeContract Type:RegularCompany:(0026) IBM Canada Limited – IBM Canada LimiteeReq ID:536700BRTravel Required:Up to 40% or 2 days a week (home on weekends- based on project requirements)

Job Title: Analyst - Financial Engineering and Modeling- AML
Job Description: Job Type: PermanentPrimary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; Burlington; Kitchener; London; Ottawa; Vaughan; WindsorOur PurposeAt Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coachingBe encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.Have many careers in one Firm.Would you like to further develop your career with our exponentially expanding Financial Advisory Service, Modelling and Value Advisory group? Are you up for the challenge to help the most sophisticated Canadian and International clients to solve their quantitative and modelling issues?What will your typical day look like?In this role you will help financial services industry (FSI) clients face quantitative issues with informed confidence. Using your deep technical skills and leveraging our global network of experts, you’ll provide professional advice to our FSI clients in a wide range of situations. The result? Our clients will be better placed to take control and receive the best solutions to their complex challenges.Develop/validate/review AML/ATF models (e.g. Transaction Monitoring, Client Risk Rating, and Sanction Screening models) based on regulatory guidelines and industry best practices.You will also be able to learn and work in other quantitative and analytical areas including customer behavior modeling, scenario modelling, capital optimization problems, and new innovations such as cloud computing, machine learning and artificial intelligence.About the teamDeloitte’s Financial Advisory practice delivers highly specialized advisory solutions for companies facing critical business events where significant value is at stake, in every phase of the economic cycle.Our work is often high profile, high impact, and highly rewarding. If you’re looking for a challenge and an opportunity to grow your career alongside the best and brightest in the industry, you’ll find it in Financial Advisory at Deloitte. Broaden your skills. Broaden your reach. Broaden your career. It’s all possible at Deloitte.Enough about us, let’s talk about youIdeally, you are someone with:Minimum 1/2 years of relevant experience spent within a model development or model validation team at a major financial institution; AML/ATF model related development and validation experience are a plusSolid academic background with a master’s degree in Statistics, Financial Engineering, Quantitative/Mathematical Finance, Financial Economics, Financial Risk Management, or other relevant post graduate degreeSolid knowledge and hands-on experience in classification model development/validation using both traditional techniques as well as AI/machine learning techniquesSolid knowledge and hands-on experience in developing/validating predictive models, risk rating methodology; Knowledge in developing/validating text parsing and matching algorithms is a plusStrong programming skills in Python, R, SQL, SAS, VBA, etc. with hands-on experience working with large and complex data are critical to success; Automation experience with any of these programming languages is a plusSelf-starter, fast-learner, and highly motivated individual who can excel under fast-paced environment and meet stringent deadlines; Strong communication skills are criticalKnowledge/experience of supervisory/regulatory requirements and guidelines including OSFI E-23, FINTRAC guidelines on AML/ATF, and PCMLTFA. Knowledge of industry best practices for AML/ATF such as Wolfsberg Principles is a plusCanadian travel required and occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignmentsOur shared valuesWhile our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategoryProducts and TechnologyJob DetailsW ho we areDo you want to shape how data will change the world? Are you ready to collaborate with inquisitive and creative people to deliver a great product to customers? At Tableau, we delight in building software that transforms messy, complicated data into a simple, curated thing of beauty. Our work helps individuals and organizations unlock the full potential of their data by removing barriers to analyzing data, answering questions, forecasting the future, creating and publishing visualizations, and sharing insights.We‘re hiring designers at multiple levels for open positions within our Tableau Design team. As a designer at Tableau, you’ll create product experiences that empower people to see and understand data. Our stellar design team offers opportunities for professional growth, mentorship, and collaboration.Who you are:Problem solver. You help teams translate deep technical conversations through a lens of user needs. You have the tenacity and creativity to work through ambiguity and tell the story of what’s possible. You are excellent at communicating your design recommendations to help drive strategy and create experiences that customers need and love.Experienced. 3 or more years’ experience doing UX design, plus a strong portfolio of design work from shipped software. You have a background in HCI, Design, or a related field, know the theory behind interaction design, and are an expert at using design tools like Figma to translate ideas into working products.Strong partner. You thrive in a collaborative environment, planning, designing, and executing as part of cross-disciplinary agile teams.Technical. You are curious about technology and can dive into complex or unfamiliar topics. You have a demonstrated ability to work on complex workflows and to simplify without oversimplifying.Persuasive. You have great communication and interpersonal skills. You successfully build consensus among a diverse group of partners. You know when to ask questions, which questions to ask, and how to listen with intent to learn. You communicate your ideas clearly and effectively to a variety of audiences.Job ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior UX Designer, you’ll be responsible for transforming complex tasks into clear, compelling, and accessible designs. Some of your responsibilities will include:Collaborating deeply with other UX disciplines, product managers and the engineering team throughout the product lifecycle to ensure your designs are addressing user and business needs, feasible to implement, and are subsequently implemented accuratelyBuild consensus and balance different priorities while dealing with ambiguity.Balance tactical design work with strategic, blue sky thinking.Advocate for simple, modern design and adherence to design conventions (e.g., responsiveness, accessibility)Create user journeys, wireframes, detailed UX flows, and prototypes that show micro interactions and full experience. Create pixel-perfect visuals for product interfaces or demos when neededInfluence decision-making through presentations and storytelling with your team and partners.Contribute to and shape our design team's platform style guide, tools and practices to scale our impact across the organization.Qualifications:Expert understanding of user-centered design methods and best practicesExceptional communication and organizational skillsA professional portfolio demonstrating impactful design experience (Note: candidates without a portfolio will not be consideredBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in HCI, Industrial Design, Graphic Design or related fieldExperience with Tableau or visual analytics in general is a plus.AccommodationsIf you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .Posting StatementAt Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. Job Title: Analyst - Financial Engineering and Modeling- AML
Job Description: Job Type: PermanentPrimary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; Burlington; Kitchener; London; Ottawa; Vaughan; WindsorOur PurposeAt Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coachingBe encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.Have many careers in one Firm.Would you like to further develop your career with our exponentially expanding Financial Advisory Service, Modelling and Value Advisory group? Are you up for the challenge to help the most sophisticated Canadian and International clients to solve their quantitative and modelling issues?What will your typical day look like?In this role you will help financial services industry (FSI) clients face quantitative issues with informed confidence. Using your deep technical skills and leveraging our global network of experts, you’ll provide professional advice to our FSI clients in a wide range of situations. The result? Our clients will be better placed to take control and receive the best solutions to their complex challenges.Develop/validate/review AML/ATF models (e.g. Transaction Monitoring, Client Risk Rating, and Sanction Screening models) based on regulatory guidelines and industry best practices.You will also be able to learn and work in other quantitative and analytical areas including customer behavior modeling, scenario modelling, capital optimization problems, and new innovations such as cloud computing, machine learning and artificial intelligence.About the teamDeloitte’s Financial Advisory practice delivers highly specialized advisory solutions for companies facing critical business events where significant value is at stake, in every phase of the economic cycle.Our work is often high profile, high impact, and highly rewarding. If you’re looking for a challenge and an opportunity to grow your career alongside the best and brightest in the industry, you’ll find it in Financial Advisory at Deloitte. Broaden your skills. Broaden your reach. Broaden your career. It’s all possible at Deloitte.Enough about us, let’s talk about youIdeally, you are someone with:Minimum 1/2 years of relevant experience spent within a model development or model validation team at a major financial institution; AML/ATF model related development and validation experience are a plusSolid academic background with a master’s degree in Statistics, Financial Engineering, Quantitative/Mathematical Finance, Financial Economics, Financial Risk Management, or other relevant post graduate degreeSolid knowledge and hands-on experience in classification model development/validation using both traditional techniques as well as AI/machine learning techniquesSolid knowledge and hands-on experience in developing/validating predictive models, risk rating methodology; Knowledge in developing/validating text parsing and matching algorithms is a plusStrong programming skills in Python, R, SQL, SAS, VBA, etc. with hands-on experience working with large and complex data are critical to success; Automation experience with any of these programming languages is a plusSelf-starter, fast-learner, and highly motivated individual who can excel under fast-paced environment and meet stringent deadlines; Strong communication skills are criticalKnowledge/experience of supervisory/regulatory requirements and guidelines including OSFI E-23, FINTRAC guidelines on AML/ATF, and PCMLTFA. Knowledge of industry best practices for AML/ATF such as Wolfsberg Principles is a plusCanadian travel required and occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignmentsOur shared valuesWhile our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.The next step is yoursSound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now!At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.Department OverviewBuilding a World-Class Technology Team at TDWe can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.TD Data and Information Management covers building, developing, designing, and implementing involved with tech data management solutions. Where do we begin? These experts analyze, design, develop and support TD's info management system; lead and support bank data curation; develop data road map and info management strategies; focus on complex data integration, and drive use of our data reference model. This area doesn't work in isolation. We love data and we feel the same about integration and our assignments prove it.There's room to grow in all of it.Job DescriptionAbout This RoleAs senior technical lead on large scale complex initiatives, provide leadership and expertise within specialized fields of data management, including analytics, business intelligence, modeling, profiling, governance etc., which may include aspects of the information management solution from an integrative perspective. Role also provides thought leadership and insights on emerging data management solutions for Bank wide or segment focused purposes.Lead coordination efforts with other technology work teams such as, ITS, Architecture, TRMIS etc. to ensure project successPerform or lead complex analysis in an evolving data environment and gather, analyze, document and maintain all data requirements related to the business applications, interfaces, and reporting environments in different kinds of data mapsApply standards and best practices to ensure that the application’s data is accurate, complete, current, understandable, and accessibleDefine, build and manage data dictionary / catalog for respective data platforms, systems / servers / applicationsManage and coordinate efforts of data modelers, data warehouse/data integration developers, and Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) data management process in database usage and data warehousingExtract data from homogeneous or heterogeneous data sources and transform the data for storing in proper format or structure for querying and analysis purposesLoad data into the final target (database, operational data stores, data marts, or data warehouse)Ensure metadata and data lineage is captured and compatible with enterprise metadata and data management tools and processesImplement , maintain and enhance Data Governance, Data Quality and related policies, in alignment with TD's Enterprise standards and frameworks in collaboration with the Data Managers/Stewards/OwnersOversee that requirements regarding privacy and security of data, data governance and access controls are appropriately capturedComply with well-defined enterprise technology delivery practices and standardsJob RequirementsWhat can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.Graduate Degree preferred.10+ years experience.Expert knowledge of technical environments and tools (e.g., user environment, applications, software, hardware, programming languages and operating systems), business processes/procedures at organizational level.Expert knowledge of business processes and procedures, as well as broader organizational issues and technology.Drive and implement Enterprise Tableau Architecture roadmap on AzureSupport the Tableau Migration to AzureRemediate findings, security, and solution gaps and incorporate automation into operational and administrative processes and proceduresMonitor the health and performance of Tableau and troubleshoot any issues with the server environment (i.e. Log analysis, performance monitoring, capacity management)Work with internal and external teams to configure and troubleshoot solution and third party tool and extensions issuesParticipate in troubleshooting calls with end users, 3rd parties, and vendors that integrate with TableauAnalyze requests and requirements for enhancing Tableau capabilities to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraintsAdditional InformationJoin in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.Job FamilyData/Information MgmtJob Category - PrimaryTechnology SolutionsHours37.5Business LineCorporateTime TypeFull TimeEmployment TypeRegularCountryCanada**Province/State (Primary)OntarioCity (Primary)LondonWork LocationCity Centre Tower A - 275 Dundas StreetJob Expires03-Apr-2022

Job Title: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst (Sr Analytics Solutions Eng...
Job Description: Job requisition number036729Job locationRichmondFull-time / part-timeFull-timePosting periodFrom 03/16/2022 to 03/31/2022OverviewWe have an opportunity for a senior analytics solutions engineer in our Innovation & Technology division to create, deliver, support and maintain analytics solutions for various WorkSafeBC business areas, including dashboards and applications using low-code/no-code technologies. You will be responsible for creating solutions which aid in performance management, operations optimization, and data exploration.You will develop solutions and conduct analysis on a wide variety of issues (e.g. occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, and injured worker claims and successful rehabilitation) using various sources of business data and communicating findings and related interpretations/observations with primarily, but not exclusively, an internal audience.Join our analytics delivery team that has been quoted by a senior Microsoft analytics consultant as “leading the Canadian public sector in our maturity of analytics”.At this time, this is a hybrid position where you will work primarily at home and be on-site at our Richmond office occasionally.What you'll doAs a senior analytics solutions engineer you will:Govern production analytics solutions by facilitating and enhancing the production solution promotion process, creating and managing templates to ensure a consistent look and feel, and ensuring the high quality of production solutions prior to promotionContribute to the evolution of the production analytics solution development practiceUse a structured approach to lead agile and waterfall/traditional projects with up to five departmental resources, including ensuring proper documentation, resourcing, planning, delegation of work, budget management, stakeholder management and coordination of work across other departmentsProvide analytics solution design leadership to the department by leading design sessions, providing guidance and mentorship, focusing on user-centric and role-centric design, and innovating new and existing analytics solution typesDesign, build, implements and support composite analytics applications and automated workflow\Manage production analytics solutions by following an asset management mindset, managing content on production analytics solution platforms, implementing security requirements, configuring administrative settings and options, and interfacing with other teams and vendors as needed. • Work with the business to elicit requirements, focusing on the intended outcome and working backwards, and proactively communicating and collaborating with internal customersIndependently discover the best available data to utilize for the analytics use-case through conducting research, understanding sources and gaps, reading through documentation and metadata, creating logic/connections/derivations to generate information and measurements.Provide ad-hoc analytics solutions and analysis, production analysis solutions design and development and quality assuranceIs this a good fit for you?We’re looking for someone who can:Independently manage technology-related projects using project management standardsLead and motivate a team of people to successElicit varied and complex business requirements and objectives and translate complex requirements into a recommended design that provides an optimal user experienceEstablish credibility and develop and maintain effective working relationships both internally within the team and with customersCritically understand and diagnose root causes to difficult or complex issues and develop innovative alternative options and solutions to address both short and long term needsProvide high quality customer service with a focus on accuracy, relevancy and timeliness based on business requirementsYour experience and educational background:An undergraduate’s degree in a related discipline such as Business or STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math)A minimum of three years in an analytics delivery roleSpecialist knowledge in analytics, business process analysis, management of information systems, and proven ability to apply key principles and methods used in a production environmentApplication Requirements:You will be required to successfully meet WorkSafeBC’s requirements with regards to a criminal record clearance.If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email HR Testing Accommodation (SM) at the time you submit your application. Standardized assessments will commence during the posting period.Who are we?At WorkSafeBC, we’re dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers compensation system for today and future generations. We’re honoured to serve the 2.4 million workers and 245,000 registered employers in our province.WorkSafeBC requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In implementing the policy, WorkSafeBC will consider its obligations to accommodate those staff who are unable to be vaccinated.We recognize that our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences, and which reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply.What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC?It’s challenging, stimulating and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.Our benefitsBeing part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes vacation, optional leave arrangements, health care and dental benefits, and contributions toward your retirement pension. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work — and life.WorkSafeBC has adopted a hybrid model offering opportunities to work remotely and onsite based on the operational needs of the position.Learn more about what we offer.This position is restricted to those legally entitled to work in Canada.Thank you, in advance, for applying.

At SCI our people make us even better, which is why we want you to be a part of our fast growing organization. SCI recognizes that having a great team is the key to success, which is why we attract and retain the right people with an employee experience that focuses on building trust, embracing change, and achieving our goals together. Any one of our 3000 industry experts will tell you that we take on some of Canada’s toughest service and logistic challenges in specialized transportation, technical services, and supply chain management. For 30 years, our proficient planning and flexible solutions have brought us top tier clients. With clear focus, operational excellence, and future growth at the core of our operation, we apply out-of-the-box thinking to deliver exceptional experiences that take our clients to the next level. Are you ready for your next challenge?The Solutions Analyst will be a valuable member in contributing to SCI’s future. This individual will be responsible for developing and supporting innovative supply chain solutions and continuous improvement initiatives for SCI’s new or existing clients. The Solutions Analyst will work directly with the Solutions Design, Implementations and Operations teams to support business analysis, detailed process mapping and analysis, transportation analysis and rating as well as other ad hoc tasks such as inventory configuration, rate comparison and analysis and facility design and location mapping. In addition, the Analyst will provide support to the Product Development team to enable SCI to achieve our short and long term business objectives. Lastly, as a member of our core team, the right person for the role will be a leading example of our culture.What success looks like: You provide a strong ability to analyse processes and data, and draw summary conclusions from the gathered dataYou are a trusted partner supporting the Operations and Implementations teams through the execution and build out of the final operational designYou support Solutions continuous improvement achievement through leading the cross-functional initiatives, reviewing and tracking key projects and initiatives across the teamYou support Solutions, Implementations and Product Development with efficient executive reporting related to key projects across the functional teamYou provide meaningful insights to support optimal solution design based on comprehensive data analysisYour business partners are excited to collaborate with you! You support one another as a team and work together, leveraging everyone’s strengths.You are depended on to see your commitments through and with good intentions.Support attainment of SCI annual
